messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

Not intended for submission until we're ready to commit to the release, but
a review for prose would be nice.

LGTM

I submitted issue 5949 and the CL to fix it. Your prose and the links for issue 5949 are accurate.

LGTM

I don't see why Setrlimit and Getrlmit need to be called out. I think
that's probably the least likely bug people are hitting.

On 3 August 2013 02:45, Russ Cox <rsc@golang.org> wrote:

> I don't see why Setrlimit and Getrlmit need to be called out. I think
> that's probably the least likely bug people are hitting.


Because it actually changes the meaning of those two functions. Someone may
have worked around it by using them backwards, and now they need to "fix"
their code.

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com, go.peter.90@gmail.com, rsc@golang.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

Please take another look.

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=897a42d03643 ***

doc: release notes for go1.1.2

R=golang-dev, go.peter.90, rsc, r
CC=golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/12016043

subject: code review 12016043: doc: release notes for go1.1.2
